      • find

        public com.mongodb.client.FindIterable<org.bson.Document> find(java.lang.String collection,
                                                               org.bson.conversions.Bson filter)
        Returns an iterable of all documents in the specified collection that match the provided filter.
        Parameters:
        collection - The name of the collection to query, as a String
        filter - A Bson filter for the query (e.g Filters.eq("name", "John Doe"))
        Returns:
        A FindIterable object

      • find

        public com.mongodb.client.FindIterable<org.bson.Document> find(java.lang.String collection,
                                                               int limit)
        Returns an iterable of documents in the specified collection that match the provided filter, capped by the limit parameter.
        Parameters:
        collection - The name of the collection to query, as a String
        limit - The max number of documents to return, as an int
        Returns:
        A FindIterable object

      • find

        public com.mongodb.client.FindIterable<org.bson.Document> find(java.lang.String collection,
                                                               org.bson.conversions.Bson filter,
                                                               int limit)
        Returns an iterable of documents in the specified collection that match the provided filter, capped by the limit parameter.
        Parameters:
        collection - The name of the collection to query, as a String
        filter - A Bson filter for the query (e.g Filters.eq("name", "John Doe"))
        limit - The max number of documents to return, as an int
        Returns:
        A FindIterable object

        Inserts a document into the specified collection in the database.

        doc - The document to be insert (Document object)

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String collection,
                   java.util.List<org.bson.Document> docs)
        Inserts multiple documents into the specified collection in the database.
        Parameters:
        collection - The name of the collection to insert into, as a String
        docs - A list of Document objects to be inserted

      • replace

        public void replace(java.lang.String collection,
                    org.bson.conversions.Bson filter,
                    org.bson.Document doc)
        Updates a document in the database with the provided document. Only updates one document per call.
        Parameters:
        collection - The name of the collection the document is in, as a String
        filter - A filter to specify which document to update
        doc - The Document object representing the updated document

      • aggregate

        public com.mongodb.client.AggregateIterable<org.bson.Document> aggregate(java.lang.String collection,
                                                                         java.util.List<org.bson.conversions.Bson> filters)
        Returns an iterable of documents that contain all the documents that result from the aggregation.
        Parameters:
        collection - The name of the collection to aggregate on, as a String
        filters - A list of Bson filters containing the aggregation methods
        Returns:
        An iterable of documents

      • aggregateBuilder

        public MongoDriver aggregateBuilder(java.lang.String collectionName)
        First step in the builder process to create an aggregate pipeline.
        Parameters:
        collectionName - The name of the collection to aggregate on, as a String
        Returns:
        MongoDriver

      • text

        public MongoDriver text(java.lang.String search)
        Add a text search to the aggregate pipeline. NOTE: For this to work, this must be the very first step after starting the aggregateBuilder.
        Parameters:
        search - Term to search for, as a String
        Returns:
        MongoDriver

      • lookup

        public MongoDriver lookup(java.lang.String fromCollection,
                          java.lang.String localField,
                          java.lang.String foreignField,
                          java.lang.String as)
        Add a lookup aggregation to the pipeline.
        Parameters:
        fromCollection - Collection to join on, as a String
        localField - Local field to match, as a String
        foreignField - Field from the fromCollection to match, as a String
        as - Name for the field that will be created as a result of the lookup, as a String
        Returns:
        MongoDriver

      • unwind

        public MongoDriver unwind(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Add an unwind aggregation to the pipeline. Will not unwind non-array objects/fields.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - Name of the field to flatten, as a String
        Returns:
        MongoDriver

      • project

        public MongoDriver project(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fields)
        Add a project aggregate to the pipeline. CURRENTLY DOES NOT WORK.
        Parameters:
        fields - A Map that maps the fields to be kept to their respective mongo fields where the values can be found.
        Returns:
        MongoDriver

      • aggregate

        public com.mongodb.client.AggregateIterable<org.bson.Document> aggregate()
        Perform the aggregation that has been build by the aggregateBuilder.
        Returns:
        An iterable containing all the documents that result from the built aggregation
